dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/1218586782 at Wed Apr 28 10:42:55 UTC 2021

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: nat Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nat"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nat"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nat"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nat"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: nat Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.

panels.title: received_tcp_packets SLI Error Ratio

sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="received_tcp_packets",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or

    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="received_tcp_packets",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nat"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="received_tcp_packets",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nat"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="received_tcp_packets",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nat"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="received_tcp_packets",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nat"})),

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: received_tcp_packets SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Monitors GCP Cloud NAT TCP packets received.
Request rate is measures in IP packets, received by the Cloud NAT.
Errors are dropped packets.

High error rates could lead to network issues, including application errors, container fetch failures, etc.



### Observability Tools

* [Cloud NAT Stackdriver Dropped Packet Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=%2DjsonPayload%2Eallocation%5Fstatus%3D%22OK%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22nat%5Fgateway%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)
panels.title: Details

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="sent_tcp_packets",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="sent_tcp_packets",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nat"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="sent_tcp_packets",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nat"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="sent_tcp_packets",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nat"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="sent_tcp_packets",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nat"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nat"})),

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: sent_tcp_packets SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Monitors GCP Cloud NAT TCP packets sent.
Request rate is measures in IP packets, sent by the Cloud NAT.
Errors are dropped packets.

High error rates could lead to network issues, including application errors, container fetch failures, etc.



### Observability Tools

* [Cloud NAT Stackdriver Dropped Packet Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=%2DjsonPayload%2Eallocation%5Fstatus%3D%22OK%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22nat%5Fgateway%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)
panels.title: Details

panels.description:
Each NAT IP address on a Cloud NAT gateway offers 64,512 TCP source ports and 64,512 UDP source ports.

When these are exhausted, processes may experience connection problems to external destinations. In the application these
may manifest as SMTP connection drops or webhook delivery failures. In Kubernetes, nodes may fail while
attempting to download images from external repositories.

More details in the Cloud NAT documentation: https://cloud.google.com/nat/docs/ports-and-addresses
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, gateway_name, project_id) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum without(nat_ip) (
        stackdriver_nat_gateway_router_googleapis_com_nat_allocated_ports{
          job="stackdriver",
          project_id=~"gitlab-production|gitlab-staging-1",
          env="$environment",environment="$environment"
        }
      )
      /
      (
        64512 * count without(nat_ip) (
          stackdriver_nat_gateway_router_googleapis_com_nat_allocated_ports{
            job="stackdriver",
            project_id=~"gitlab-production|gitlab-staging-1",
            env="$environment",environment="$environment"
          }
        )
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nat_gateway_port_allocation component saturation: Cloud NAT Gateway Port Allocation

panels.description:
Cloud NAT will allocate a set of NAT ports to each host in a cluster. When these are all allocated,
Cloud NAT may be unable to allocate any more.

When this happens, processes may experience connection problems to external destinations. In the application these
may manifest as SMTP connection drops or webhook delivery failures. In Kubernetes, nodes may fail while
attempting to download images from external repositories.

More details in the Cloud NAT documentation: https://cloud.google.com/nat/docs/ports-and-addresses.

Note: when reviewing the detail chart for this saturation point, the instance_id can be resolved using
`gcloud compute instances list --project gitlab-production --filter "id=$instance_id"`.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, instance_id, nat_gateway_name, zone) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum without(ip_protocol) (
        max_over_time(
          stackdriver_gce_instance_compute_googleapis_com_nat_port_usage{
            job="stackdriver",
            project_id=~"gitlab-production|gitlab-staging-1",
            env="$environment",environment="$environment"
          }[5m]
        )
      )
      /
      sum without (nat_ip) (
        max_over_time(
          stackdriver_gce_instance_compute_googleapis_com_nat_allocated_ports{
            job="stackdriver",
            project_id=~"gitlab-production|gitlab-staging-1",
            env="$environment",environment="$environment"
          }[5m]
        )
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nat_host_port_allocation component saturation: Cloud NAT Host Port Allocation

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that are breaching their soft SLO thresholds at this instant

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 1 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
  clamp_max(
    gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", type="nat", stage=~"|$stage"}
    ,
    1
  ) >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})

panels.title: Currently Saturated Resources

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their current value and weekly variance, have a high probability of breaching their soft thresholds limits within the next few hours

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 7 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="nat", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="nat", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
      , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_inodes", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_inodes", severity="s2"})

absent(fake_dne{component="shared_runners_gitlab", alert_dashboard="sat_shared_runners_gitlab", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="sidekiq_shard_workers", alert_dashboard="sat_sidekiq_shard_workers", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="single_node_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_single_node_cpu", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="single_node_puma_workers", alert_dashboard="sat_single_node_puma_workers", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="workhorse_image_scaling", alert_dashboard="sat_wh_image_scaling", severity="s4"})
)

panels.title: Resources Currently at Risk of being Saturated

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their growth rate over the the past week, and their weekly variance, are likely to breach their soft thresholds limits in the next 14d

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 30 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:predict_linear_2w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="nat", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="nat", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
    , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_inodes", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_inodes", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_space", severity="s2"})

or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_write_throughput", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_write_throughput", severity="s3"})
or

panels.title: Resources Forecasted to be at Risk of Saturation in 14d

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="nat",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"$stage|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation - Rolling 1w average trend

graph TD
  subgraph inf
  nat
end
